attributes.review: i download this app after my lord and savior donald, told us to drink bleach. i wanted to know his secret to being an intellectual so i downloaded this app. it did not make me smart😼🧚‍♂️this app is great🧚‍♂️💖💖🌼✨if you’re an idiot🧚‍♂️✨😌💅💖
attributes.title: terrible

attributes.review: the day i downloaded this app my life became a horror movie. everywhere i went, donald was there. staring at me. each time i looked back his eyes got bigger. the smell of cheeto dust consumed me. i couldn’t breathe. i asked him what he wanted. did he need me to delete the app? he said no. he required a sacrifice. he needed me to journey to find a time machine and bring to him 13 year old me. see, i was the chosen one but he preferred his girls much younger. the moment i refused, my house went up in flames. i ran out with the few belongings i could grab, and jumped in my car. it wouldn’t start. the theme from Us was playing from i didn’t know where. was it inside my head? could everyone hear it? my car radio? no. it was everywhere. seeping through the grass and the concrete. it was playing from the earth. i tried to start my car a few more times and realized he did something to fry the engine. i pulled out my phone. my parents will know what to do. i dialed my moms number and thanked the lord when it actually worked. donald j trump picked up. he said if i won’t do his bidding my family will to keep me safe. i told him i had left the house and was already on my way to safety. just then, three men in riot gear forcefully pulled me out of my car. they stuffed me in a bag and we were off. the next thing i remember was waking up on a cold hard floor. i was in donald’s bunker. he was nowhere to be found. i was suspicious of the bag of cheetos in the pantry (could easily have been him in disguise) so i locked the bag in a closet just in case. he never appeared. i called everyone i knew for help. donald answered every. single. phone. call. every time i called his voice felt closer. i stopped calling. on my last night in the bunker, though i hardly knew it at the time, i felt another presence in the room. it was comforting, though, considering that i had been alone in that bunker for 666 days. i talked to the presence. i asked who they were and what they wanted. they told me i had one last chance to do donald’s bidding. i went to sleep. and woke up in my grave, the sound of my mother sobbing above ground. there was no way out. i was strapped into my casket. luckily, i had gotten used to hiding my phone ~down under~ ~deep inside~ so it wouldn’t be confiscated. i pulled it out. dried it off a bit. and pulled up the app store. my story will not go unheard. hear me, apple. from six feet below. hear my story.
attributes.title: horrific

attributes.review: No Cheetos just an angry guy in a bunker
